hint.text:
Terms common to both the numerator and denominator can be cancelled.
For example :
\(\frac{x^3abc}{xab},\,\)where x, a, b, c are non-zero intergers; can be expressed as
\('x^2c'\,\)because \('xab'\,\)is the common term for the numerator and denominator.

solution.text:
\(\frac{_{{3*j}}_t^3}{_{{2*j}}_t}\)
Taking \(_{j}_t\,\)common in the numerator and denominator,
\(=\frac{(3)t^2(_{j}_t)}{(2)(_{j}_t)}\)
Dividing numerator and denominator by \(_{j}_t,\)
\(=\frac{3t^2}2\)
